abstract: Argentine Judge Daniel Rafecas dismisses criminal allegations against country's Pres Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner, who was accused of covering up Iran's alleged role in 1994 bombing of Jewish community center; investigators are still trying to determine mysterious death of prosecutor Alberto Nisman day before he was to present his findings before Congress.
lead_paragraph: President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner had been accused by the prosecutor Alberto Nisman of conspiring to shield Iranian officials from responsibility for the bombing of a Jewish center in 1994.

headline.main: Case Against Argentine President, Brought by Prosecutor Who Died, Is Dismissed
headline.print_headline: Case Against Argentine President, Brought by Prosecutor Who Died, Is Dismissed

snippet: President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner had been accused by the prosecutor Alberto Nisman of conspiring to shield Iranian officials from responsibility for the bombing of a Jewish center in 1994.
